intro: Neuburgia corynocarpa var. sarcantha, commonly known as the Neuburgia corynocarpa var. sarcantha, is a rare and less-studied plant species. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its unique leaf morphology and flowering patterns. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forests or undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a botanical curiosity with potential ecological significance.
